states.description: Empty backpack (40L). Checklist on table: clothes (2 sets), toiletries, chargers, documents, medicine, water bottle. Items scattered on bed.
Clothes (1 set) neatly folded and placed at the bottom of the backpack. Remaining clothes, toiletries, chargers, documents, medicine, and water bottle on the bed.
Toiletries placed in a ziplock bag (for potential liquid restrictions) and then added to the backpack, on top of clothes. Remaining items on bed.
Chargers and documents placed in a separate compartment or pocket of the backpack, accessible from the outside. Medicine and water bottle on bed.
Medicine placed in a side pocket of the backpack, along with any necessary instructions.
Water bottle placed on top of clothes but easily accessible. Backpack is nearly full.
Backpack is packed, checked for weight (slightly exceeding carry-on limit). Clothes are rearranged; bulky jacket on bed is swapped for a thinner one.
Backpack is repacked; weight checked and now within carry-on limits. All items are inside, but there is still some space available.
Backpack is packed efficiently, weight is well-distributed, easy-access items on top, and within airline carry-on limits. Checklist is complete.

actions.description: Place one set of clothes at the bottom of the backpack.
Place toiletries (in a ziplock bag) on top of the clothes.
Place chargers and documents in an accessible compartment.
Put the medicine into a side pocket.
Place the water bottle on top of clothes for easy access.
Check the weight of the backpack and repack. Swap bulky jacket for a thinner one
Repack the backpack to ensure items are secure and accessible, also within weight limits.
Final check and finalize. Backpack is complete and ready for the trip.
